doc.field: Elizabeth Keegin Colley photographs of Prospect Park
Elizabeth Keegin Colley photographs of Prospect Park

The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The images were included in the book Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece, which was written by her husband, David P. Colley. Images include the Long Meadow, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, and other features of the park.

The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The images were included in the book Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece, which was written by her husband, David P. Colley. Images include the Long Meadow, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, and other features of the park.

The collection includes eighteen color photographs of Prospect Park, Brooklyn, New York, by Elizabeth Keegin Colley. The photographs include images of the Long Meadow, Ambergill Falls, the Lake, Vale of Cashmere, Meadowport Arch, Lullwater Bridge, and Boathouse, as well as some of the park's flora and fauna. The collection includes Elizabeth Colley's captions for her photographs.

The photographs are pigment inkjet on archival paper, printed from digital images. The images are printed on sixteen sheets (two sheets include two images each), measuring about 25" x 17". Some of these photographs can be viewed on Colley's website.

Photographer Elizabeth Keegin Colley and her husband, David P. Colley, often worked together as a photographer/writer team. In the early 2000s, they responded to a request for proposals from the Prospect Park Alliance for a history of the park. With the winning proposal, the Colleys set to work on what would be published as Prospect Park: Olmsted & Vaux's Brooklyn Masterpiece (New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2013). The images in this collection were included, along with many others, in the book.
(For further information, see the Brownstoner's 2013 on-line interview with the Colleys.)
Gift from the photographer, Elizabeth Keegin Colley, September 2014.
